code:
# @param {Integer} n
# @param {Integer} k
# @param {Integer} budget
# @param {Integer[][]} composition
# @param {Integer[]} stock
# @param {Integer[]} cost
# @return {Integer}
def max_number_of_alloys(n, k, budget, composition, stock, cost)
  max_alloys = 0
  (0...k).each do |machine|
    total_cost = 0
    alloys_possible_for_machine = Float::INFINITY
    (0...n).each do |metal|
      required_metal_per_alloy = composition[machine][metal]
      total_required_metal = required_metal_per_alloy - stock[metal]
      if total_required_metal > 0
        cost_for_metal = total_required_metal * cost[metal]
        total_cost += cost_for_metal
        alloys_for_this_metal = (budget - total_cost) / (required_metal_per_alloy * cost[metal])
        alloys_possible_for_machine = [alloys_possible_for_machine, alloys_for_this_metal].min
      end
    end
    if total_cost <= budget
      total_alloys_possible = [(budget - total_cost) / composition[machine].map.with_index { |comp, index| comp * cost[index] }.sum, 0].max
      max_alloys = [max_alloys, total_alloys_possible].max
    end
  end
  max_alloys
end
